From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
Papuan language of Papua New Guinea
Kein
Bemal
Native toPapua New Guinea
RegionMadang Province
Native speakers
(1,800 cited 2000 census)[1]
Language family
Trans–New Guinea
  • Madang
    • Croisilles linkage
      • Mabuso?
        • Kokon
          • Kein
Language codes
ISO 639-3bmh
Glottologkein1239

Kein, also known as Bemal, is a Papuan language of Papua New Guinea.

References

[edit]
  1. ^ Kein at Ethnologue (18th ed., 2015) (subscription required)
